Dragon, reminds me of what myself and a few other kids in high school did for an English project. We were supposed to recreate a scene from a book, and Red Vs Blue had just become a thing, so we basically just copied RvB and used dialogue from the book.
Lol
RvB was awsome!

We focus on complete audio replacement in video. Starting out in simple stuff like a 15 second avalanche video and an F1 car passing by on a track. To the final program class where we spend the entire semester on a single video of our choice.
Dang
But all of them start out as completely mute videos for us to work with.
Video game trailers are just very convenient, but others do things like snippets form movies.
Last semester someone took a few minutes out of Howl's Moving Castle.
But like that Blizzard trailer...it was close to the original right? That is the point?
It just depends on the student.
Thats what we do in filmmaking
It's up to student discretion. Some take it super serious, some take it in oddball directions, some just try to put a bit of a spin on it.
We do stuff like Napoleon Dynamite Central Intelligence Big Bang Theory and some stuff from Studio C
The point is to make it the best that you can that demonstrates your abilities.
So that you can take what you make and start a reel you can show to agencies so that you can get jobs.
